relationship_matrix.description: Initial relationship states at story start (Chapter 1). Will evolve through the narrative.
relationship_matrix.timestamp: Story beginning - before first alien contact

relationships.power_dynamic: Shanice has positional authority as supervisor; Terry has seniority through time at company
relationships.a_views_b: Competent supervisor who's overworked and stressed. Doesn't want to cause her problems. Slightly intimidated by her authority but appreciates she's fair.
relationships.b_views_a: Reliable worker who could do more if he engaged. Wishes he'd use his intelligence instead of coasting. Protective of him as one of her team.
relationships.tensions: None initially. Tension develops when Terry's alien situation threatens her job security.
relationships.shared_history: Five years working same shift. Professional courtesy, occasional break room small talk. Not personal friends.
relationships.arc_prediction: Will develop into mutual trust and collaborative partnership. Shanice recognizes Terry's capabilities; Terry learns to trust her judgment.

relationships.power_dynamic: Equal. Different departments, both low-level employees.
relationships.emotional_valence: Positive. Bonded through shared night shift misery.
relationships.a_views_b: Harmless conspiracy theorist who's good company for boring shifts. Doesn't take Kevin's signal theories seriously but finds them entertaining.
relationships.b_views_a: One of few people who doesn't openly mock his theories. Wishes Terry would engage more seriously. Sees potential ally.
relationships.tensions: Terry's dismissal of Kevin's warnings. Kevin's frustration at not being believed.
relationships.shared_history: Three years of overlapping night shifts. Play games online together occasionally. Exchange memes about corporate hellscape. Surface-level friendship.
relationships.arc_prediction: Kevin is proven right; Terry must rely on his expertise. Develops into genuine friendship based on mutual respect and shared mission.

relationships.power_dynamic: Will be complex - Bundle has information and cosmic backing; Terry has home field advantage and agency
relationships.emotional_valence: Will evolve from confusion to strange camaraderie
relationships.a_views_b: Initially: prank call. Then: terrifying cosmic entity. Eventually: strange kindred spirit, fellow cog in incomprehensible system.
relationships.b_views_a: Account representative for Earth subscription. Helpful human contact. Possibly friend? (Unclear if it understands friendship.)
relationships.tensions: Communication barrier. Uncertainty about Bundle's true nature and intentions. Question of whether it's helping or threatening humanity.
relationships.shared_history: None yet. First contact happens Chapter 1.
relationships.arc_prediction: Develop unusual cross-species bond through crisis. Terry becomes Bundle's human contact; Bundle becomes Terry's window into cosmic perspective.

relationships.power_dynamic: She has credentials and expertise; he has the direct contact and evidence
relationships.a_views_b: Desperate cold-call at 3 AM to someone he Googled. Intimidated by credentials. Grateful she believes him. Respects her scientific approach.
relationships.b_views_a: Initially skeptical of random call center worker. Impressed by his evidence gathering and journalistic instincts. Comes to value his practical intelligence.
relationships.tensions: Different approaches - his journalistic/intuitive vs. her scientific/methodical. Time pressure vs. need for verification.
relationships.shared_history: None. Meet through Terry's 3 AM desperate call to local SETI researcher.
relationships.arc_prediction: Become collaborative partners. She provides scientific framework; he provides access and ground-level perspective. Mutual learning.

relationships.power_dynamic: Massive power imbalance - Kowalski can fire Terry, has resources and connections
relationships.emotional_valence: Terry: resentment of corporate exploitation. Kowalski: dismissive of low-level worker.
relationships.a_views_b: Symbol of corporate greed. Everything wrong with the system. Disgusted by his opportunism when revealed. Determined to prevent his control of situation.
relationships.b_views_a: Barely aware of existence until crisis. Sees as useful tool then obstacle. Completely underestimates him.
relationships.tensions: Kowalski tries to exploit first contact for profit. Terry fights to do right thing. Direct conflict.
relationships.shared_history: None. Terry has worked for SatellitePro for 5 years but never met CEO.
relationships.arc_prediction: Antagonistic relationship. Kowalski tries to control situation; Terry and allies must outmaneuver him to protect humanity's interests.

relationships.power_dynamic: She's his supervisor, but different departments mean limited direct authority
relationships.a_views_b: Harmless, good at his job, bit odd with conspiracy theories but who isn't a bit odd on night shift. Appreciates he causes no problems.
relationships.b_views_a: Fair boss who doesn't give him hard time about his quirks. Respects her competence. Wants her approval.
relationships.tensions: None initially. She's skeptical of his theories which frustrates him, but it's minor.
relationships.shared_history: Three years working same shift. She approved his IT setup requests. Occasional friendly interactions.
relationships.arc_prediction: She comes to respect his technical expertise. He proves his value. Mutual appreciation deepens.

relationships.power_dynamic: Shanice tries to assert supervisory authority; Bundle doesn't understand human hierarchies
relationships.emotional_valence: Shanice: protective suspicion. Bundle: confused attempts to follow protocol.
relationships.a_views_b: Threat to her team and job. Skeptical it's real. Protective anger. When proven real: concern about implications for Maya's future.
relationships.b_views_a: Supervisor level management. Attempts to escalate through proper channels. Confused by her resistance to what it sees as customer service opportunity.
relationships.tensions: Shanice's skepticism vs. Bundle's earnest attempts to communicate. Her protectiveness vs. its agenda.
relationships.shared_history: None. First contact through Terry's call.
relationships.arc_prediction: Grudging acceptance of reality. Shanice focuses on protecting people from situation while trying to manage impossible customer service scenario.

relationships.power_dynamic: Different kinds of authority - Shanice's practical/managerial, Angela's academic/scientific
relationships.a_views_b: Initially suspicious of outsider who might exploit situation. Respects credentials but protective of information. Gradually trusts through shared problem-solving.
relationships.b_views_a: Impressed by practical intelligence and leadership. Different backgrounds but recognizes competence. Appreciates grounded perspective.
relationships.tensions: Shanice's protectiveness vs. Angela's need for information. Different priorities initially.
relationships.arc_prediction: Develop collaborative relationship. Mutual recognition of different but complementary strengths. Both are women of color navigating male-dominated fields (corporate/academic) creates unspoken understanding.

relationships.power_dynamic: Massive. He can fire her, eliminate her position, destroy her livelihood.
relationships.emotional_valence: Shanice: deep distrust. Kowalski: indifferent to her existence.
relationships.a_views_b: Has seen him make decisions that hurt workers. Expects exploitation. Righteous anger at his opportunism. Protective of her team from him.
relationships.b_views_a: Barely registers her existence. Middle management tool. When she opposes him, threatens her job without second thought.
relationships.tensions: Direct conflict when she protects her team from his exploitation. Her job and Maya's security vs. her principles.
relationships.shared_history: She's worked there 16 years; he's been CEO for 5. She's seen him fire people, cut benefits, prioritize profit. They've never directly interacted until crisis.
relationships.arc_prediction: She stands up to him despite risk. He underestimates her. She helps undermine his control of situation.

relationships.power_dynamic: Kevin has technical expertise; Bundle has cosmic information
relationships.emotional_valence: Kevin: excited validation. Bundle: attempts communication through shared technical language.
relationships.a_views_b: Vindication! This is what he's been tracking. Fascinated rather than frightened. Wants to document everything. Sees it as proof he was right.
relationships.b_views_a: Technical support specialist. Attempts to communicate using IT jargon from tech support TV shows. May provide technical specifications.
relationships.tensions: Kevin's excitement vs. need for caution. His desire to share discovery vs. security needs.
relationships.shared_history: None. Kevin has been tracking signal anomalies Bundle may have caused.
relationships.arc_prediction: Kevin becomes technical liaison. His documentation and skills are crucial. Finally taken seriously as expert.

relationships.power_dynamic: She has academic authority; he has practical expertise and data
relationships.a_views_b: Starstruck by credentials. Nervous about being dismissed as conspiracy theorist. Desperate for validation from 'real scientist.' Excited to collaborate.
relationships.b_views_a: Initially skeptical of conspiracy theorist with no credentials. Recognizes his genuine technical skills and valuable data. Impressed by his documentation. Defends him to others.
relationships.tensions: Credentials vs. practical expertise. Academic rigor vs. pattern recognition intuition.
relationships.arc_prediction: She validates his work and abilities. He learns to present findings more effectively. Collaborative relationship based on complementary skills.

relationships.relationship_type: none (CEO doesn't know IT guy exists)
relationships.power_dynamic: Kowalski has all positional power; Kevin has information Kowalski wants
relationships.emotional_valence: Kevin: distrust of corporate leadership. Kowalski: dismissive.
relationships.a_views_b: Represents everything wrong with corporate exploitation. Expects him to weaponize discovery for profit. Angry at his involvement. Determined to protect information.
relationships.b_views_a: IT is interchangeable. Tries to control through job threats. Underestimates his importance and loyalty to team.
relationships.tensions: Kowalski wants Kevin's data and technical access. Kevin refuses to cooperate. Direct conflict.
relationships.shared_history: None. Kevin has worked there 3 years; Kowalski is unaware of his existence until crisis.
relationships.arc_prediction: Kevin resists Kowalski's attempts at control. Uses technical expertise to undermine Kowalski's plans. Chooses team loyalty over job security.

relationships.power_dynamic: Angela seeks scientific understanding; Bundle has information but limited communication ability
relationships.emotional_valence: Angela: scientific fascination mixed with frustration. Bundle: provides data in confusing format.
relationships.a_views_b: Life's work validated but in most frustrating way possible. Cosmic joke that elegant search resulted in customer service call. Works to decode communication and understand intentions.
relationships.b_views_a: Expert consultant. May provide her with technical data about subscription service. Unclear if it grasps her scientific approach.
relationships.tensions: Her need for clear information vs. its TV-language communication. Scientific method vs. impossible reality.
relationships.shared_history: None. Her career searching for what it represents.
relationships.arc_prediction: She works to establish clearer communication. Scientific documentation of first contact. Frustration gives way to acceptance of messy reality.

relationships.power_dynamic: Different spheres - she has academic authority, he has business power
relationships.emotional_valence: Angela: academic disdain. Kowalski: attempts to co-opt her credentials.
relationships.a_views_b: Represents profit-motivated exploitation of discovery. Everything wrong with treating scientific moment as business opportunity. Protective of scientific integrity.
relationships.b_views_a: Useful credibility if he can control her. Threat to his narrative if she opposes him. Attempts to discredit when she resists.
relationships.tensions: Direct conflict over control of information and situation. Scientific ethics vs. business exploitation.
relationships.shared_history: None. Different worlds until crisis brings them into conflict.
relationships.arc_prediction: She opposes his exploitation. Uses her credibility and platform to undermine his control. He attempts to discredit her.

relationships.power_dynamic: Kowalski assumes he has negotiating power; Bundle operates on incomprehensible logic
relationships.a_views_b: Business opportunity of lifetime. Exclusive Earth representative. Potential monopoly on interstellar communication. Tries to negotiate deals.
relationships.b_views_a: Executive decision maker. May try to offer 'premium packages.' Unclear if Bundle understands his approach or finds it relevant.
relationships.tensions: Kowalski fundamentally misunderstands situation as business transaction. His attempts to control/monetize create danger.
relationships.shared_history: None. Kowalski doesn't know about Bundle until crisis.
relationships.arc_prediction: Kowalski's business approach to cosmic situation creates escalating problems. Bundle may not understand or care about his attempted negotiations. His interference endangers everyone.

central_nodes: Terrence_Mitchell (hub connecting all other characters through crisis)

power_structures.moral_authority: Angela, Shanice (earned through competence and ethics)
power_structures.practical_power: Kevin (technical access), Terry (alien contact), Shanice (team loyalty)

thematic_relationship_notes.class_dynamics: Working class characters (Terry, Shanice, Kevin) vs. CEO (Kowalski). Academic outsider (Angela) bridges worlds.
thematic_relationship_notes.expertise_types: Credentialed (Angela) vs. practical (Kevin, Shanice) vs. experiential (Terry). All prove valuable.
thematic_relationship_notes.trust_networks: Trust built through crisis and shared values, not hierarchy. Official power structures work against effective response.
thematic_relationship_notes.cosmic_irony: Humanity's first contact routed through lowest levels of failing company, not governments or scientists. The 'wrong' people for the job become exactly the right people.
